PAD_GotSeluneItem_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is a an amulet of Selune.

TaraKilled_AD.synopsis: (Companion) Gale sees Tara, his Tressym, killed.
TaraKilled_AD.how_to_trigger: Recruit Gale as companion.Approach Tara.Kill Tara.

PAD_SawDuergarItem_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item.

PAD_SawHagItem_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is a Staff of Crones.

AvatarStrengthens.synopsis: Gale Avatar has consumed a magic item and the bomb abates.
AvatarStrengthens.how_to_trigger: With Gale Avatar use the debug spell to mimic consuming a magic item.

PAD_GotSeluneItem_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is a an amulet of Selune.

PAD_GotTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is a Sword of Tyr.

PAD_GotDuergarItem_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item.

PAD_SawDangerousBook_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is a book of Thayan necromancy.

Intro.synopsis: Character Creation dialog for Avatar Gale
Intro.how_to_trigger: Select the character as an avatar in character creation and click the button that plays their voiced character description

PAD_SawIdol_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is an Idol of Silvanus.

PAD_GotIronFlask_Double.synopsis: PAD when you obtain the Iron flask and Gale is with you.

PAD_SawTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is a Sword of Tyr.

PAD_SawTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is a Sword of Tyr.

PAD_GotMyconidItem_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is a drow cowl called the Shadow of Menzoberranzan.

Deathvoice_Reminder.synopsis: Narrator reminder that Gale needs resurrecting.

DeathFlute.synopsis: In this dialog the player can make a magma mephit appear that when answered correctly will breathe fire on a letter, turning it into a powerful magical scroll. The language the mephit speaks is called Ignan and can be spoken as the words appear – simply think away the many apostrophes. In the actor context are the approximations of what the mephit is saying so that the tone can be matched to the content.
DeathFlute.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. recruit Gale4. Kill gale5. Loot the pouch on his body6. Open the pouch with Gale's instruction and take the flute7. Play the flute

PAD_SawMyconidItem_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is the Cowl of Menzobarranzan.

AD_AvatarStrengthens.synopsis: Gale Avatar has consumed a magic item and the bomb abates.This is a fallback AD.
AD_AvatarStrengthens.how_to_trigger: With Gale, use the debug spell to mimic consuming a magic item while in combat.

PAD_SawDangerousBook_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is a book of Thayan necromancy.

PAD_SawHagItem_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is a Staff of Crones.

PAD_GotIdol_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is the Idol of Silvanus.

AD_AvatarWorsens.synopsis: Gale Avatar - after having journeyed for a while, Gale feels weak from the bomb that exist in him.This is a fallback if he's not available for a full cinematic dialogue.
AD_AvatarWorsens.how_to_trigger: With Gale Avatar, go to the following locations (have Gale in combat when he arrives at the 3rd, 5th or 7th)S_DEN_RangerDen_SUB_50062397-bf9c-4765-9cbc-e40b5148f211S_HAG_HagLair_f84e3319-4a1d-483c-a718-dee3bff70d07S_UND_MyconidCircle_SUB_4b5cc8fc-88f4-465e-bf82-4c20b055c019S_UND_DuergarCamp_SUB_05c3bf1f-29a6-437c-9a98-c1ff0ec53a53S_GOB_ThroneRoom_SUB_bb81678b-641c-43fc-bd41-53295d59be03S_PLA_Plains_SUB_bcc3efa5-bfe1-4224-9df1-6758cac764cdS_FOR_ForestVillage_SUB_21e6bfbf-c5c9-4e99-97f8-2df7143967c4

PAD_SawMyconidItem_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is the Cowl of Menzobarranzan.

PAD_SawIdol_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is an Idol of Silvanus.

PAD_GotDuergarItem_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This is a pair of boots called the Night Walkers.

PAD_GotIronFlask_Single.synopsis: PAD when the players find the Iron flask and can give it to Gale.

PAD_GotTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is a Sword of Tyr.

PAD_DeathNoteLava.synopsis: Reacting to a scroll being thrown into lava and revealing itself as a scroll of true resurrection - one normally obtained by conducting a ritual that summons a mephit to cast lava on the scroll. Here, the player likely figured out a workaround.

PAD_GotHagItem_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is the Staff of Crones taken from the Hag.

PAD_GotMyconidItem_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is a drow cowl called the Shadow of Menzoberranzan.

PAD_SawSeluneItem_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is an Amulet of Selune.

PAD_SawSeluneItem_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you see one such item. This one is an Amulet of Selune.

PAD_GotIdol_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is the Idol of Silvanus.

PAD_GotDangerousBook_Double.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is a Thayan book of necromancy.

PAD_GotHagItem_Single.synopsis: Gale is interested in items woven with especially powerful magic. In these lines, you come across one such item. This one is the Staff of Crones taken from the Hag.

DeathPouch.synopsis: This dialog describes the interaction with a magic pouch. Only if the players know how to open it can they do so successfully. If not, the pouch self-destructs, destroying the contents within.
DeathPouch.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Recruit Gale4. Kill Gale 5. Loot the pouch on his body6. Open the pouch

PAD_GotSeluneItem_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotSeluneItem_Single_0.text: An amulet of Selûne. I think Gale might want this.

TaraKilled_AD_0.speaker: Gale
TaraKilled_AD_0.context: NodeContext: Horrified cry. His pet was killed

PAD_SawDuergarItem_Double_1.speaker: Player
PAD_SawDuergarItem_Double_1.text: Those boots look quite special. Something for you, perhaps, Gale?

PAD_SawDuergarItem_Double_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_SawDuergarItem_Double_0.text: From what I can gather from afar, they do seem mighty interesting.

PAD_SawHagItem_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawHagItem_Single_0.text: That odd staff might be of interest to Gale.

AvatarStrengthens_0.speaker: Narrator
AvatarStrengthens_0.text: *The magic you consumed did almost nothing to help you. Something's wrong.*

AvatarStrengthens_1.speaker: Narrator
AvatarStrengthens_1.text: *The magic you just consumed floods your body, dampening the necrotic power lurking within. You exhale in relief.*

AvatarStrengthens_2.speaker: Narrator
AvatarStrengthens_2.text: *The magic you just consumed offered some relieve, but the necrotic power within you is still hungry. You need more.*

AvatarStrengthens_3.speaker: Narrator
AvatarStrengthens_3.text: *You breathe a little easier. The magic you consumed has staved off the dark hunger within you - for now.*

AvatarStrengthens_4.speaker: Narrator
AvatarStrengthens_4.text: *The magic you consumed gives a small amount of relief, but the necrotic power within shall soon gnaw at you again.*

AvatarStrengthens_5.speaker: Narrator
AvatarStrengthens_5.text: *The orb settles within you. It is sated, yet dissatisfied - a disturbing development, but one you need not act on, for now.*

AvatarStrengthens_6.speaker: Narrator
AvatarStrengthens_6.text: *The magic you just consumed quells the necrotic hunger lurking within. You let out a sigh of relief.*

AvatarStrengthens_7.speaker: Narrator
AvatarStrengthens_7.text: *Though the item was enough to quell the orb's complaints, it remains disturbed, disjointed. It will not be appeased by such fare much longer.*

PAD_GotSeluneItem_Double_1.speaker: Player
PAD_GotSeluneItem_Double_1.text: Fancy amulet like this is probably enchanted. Gale, take a look.

PAD_GotSeluneItem_Double_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_GotSeluneItem_Double_0.text: Forged with Selûne's blessing. Yes, I can most certainly use this!

PAD_GotTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Single_0.text: A sword like this would certainly get Gale's attention.

PAD_GotDuergarItem_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotDuergarItem_Single_0.text: These boots have clearly been enchanted with powerful magic. I think Gale might be interested.

PAD_SawDangerousBook_Double_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawDangerousBook_Double_0.text: Hm. From the looks of that book, Gale might want it.

PAD_SawDangerousBook_Double_1.speaker: Gale
PAD_SawDangerousBook_Double_1.text: I can almost taste it's magic. Yes. Just the thing.

Intro_6.speaker: Origin_Intro_Gale
Intro_6.text: You find yourself in the presence of the renowned wizarding prodigy, Gale of Waterdeep - please, no need to be intimidated.
Intro_6.context: NodeContext: Confident, slightly pompous tone - trying to impress you, even if he pretends otherwise

Intro_4.speaker: Origin_Intro_Gale
Intro_4.text: My virtuosic talents once caught the eye of the goddess of magic herself, Mystra, who named me her Chosen, and her lover.

Intro_7.speaker: Origin_Intro_Gale
Intro_7.text: Thanks to a slight miscalculation on my part, that relationship eventually soured, as did the greatest of my powers.
Intro_7.context: NodeContext: Hint of bitterness here - this was his downfall, a very sore point

Intro_2.speaker: Origin_Intro_Gale
Intro_2.text: Now I'm merely a humble wizard on the road to redemption. Unless I can find the path to something greater...
Intro_2.context: NodeContext: Last sentence here should hint at the darker path that might lie ahead for Gale - a sense that he's not content to be a humble wizard, however much he might pretend to be

Intro_1.speaker: Origin_Intro_Gale
Intro_1.text: You find yourself in the presence of the renowned wizarding prodigy, Gale of Waterdeep - please, no need to be intimidated.
Intro_1.context: NodeContext: Confident, slightly pompous tone - trying to impress you, even if he pretends otherwise

Intro_0.speaker: Origin_Intro_Gale
Intro_0.text: My virtuosic talents once caught the eye of the goddess of magic herself, Mystra, who named me her Chosen, and her lover.

Intro_3.speaker: Origin_Intro_Gale
Intro_3.text: Not satisfied with this I tried to impress her further, accidentally freeing 'the orb' - a volatile fragment of Weave corrupted by Netherese magic.

Intro_9.speaker: Origin_Intro_Gale
Intro_9.text: The orb buried itself in my chest, primed to unleash destruction - unless I keep it fed with potent magical artefacts.

Intro_5.speaker: Origin_Intro_Gale
Intro_5.text: Now, cast aside by my goddess, stripped of the greatest of my powers, I'm merely a humbled wizard seeking a road to redemption. Unless I can find the path to something greater...

PAD_SawIdol_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawIdol_Single_0.text: Looks like that idol is enchanted. Might be worth getting a hold of for Gale.

PAD_GotIronFlask_Double_1.speaker: Player
PAD_GotIronFlask_Double_1.text: The magic nearly oozes from this flask. Can you use it?

PAD_GotIronFlask_Double_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_GotIronFlask_Double_0.text: A fortunate find indeed. Allow me to take it off your hands.

PAD_SawTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Single_0.text: I wager that blade has a mighty enchantment. Gale could tell me more.
PAD_SawTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Single_0.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Like smelling a steak.

PAD_SawTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double_1.speaker: Player
PAD_SawTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double_1.text: By my eye, that blade's magical. What do you think, Gale?

PAD_SawTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_SawTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double_0.text: There's an air about it like a soft mist. Weave to be sure.

PAD_GotMyconidItem_Double_1.speaker: Player
PAD_GotMyconidItem_Double_1.text: Feels like there's magic in every thread of this cowl. Something for Gale, certainly.

PAD_GotMyconidItem_Double_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_GotMyconidItem_Double_0.text: Very fine drow weave indeed, if you'll excuse the pun. I can most certainly use it.

Deathvoice_Reminder_0.speaker: Narrator
Deathvoice_Reminder_0.text: *Given Gale's adamant insistence that he not be allowed to die, he's making quite a habit of it. Thank goodness he has you to bring him back...*

Deathvoice_Reminder_1.speaker: Narrator
Deathvoice_Reminder_1.text: *Gale's corpse is silent, but his silence speaks a thousand words: most of them to the tune of 'why haven't you resurrected me yet?'*

Deathvoice_Reminder_2.speaker: Narrator
Deathvoice_Reminder_2.text: *To say Gale keeps a tenuous grasp on his mortality would be an understatement. You know what he expects of you - to resurrect him. If only it didn't need to happen quite so often.*

Deathvoice_Reminder_3.speaker: Narrator
Deathvoice_Reminder_3.text: *Gale lies on the precipice of his own mortality once more. As might you, if you don't resurrect him soon.*

Deathvoice_Reminder_5.speaker: Narrator
Deathvoice_Reminder_5.text: *Gale's never been so quiet. Peaceful as it may be, you'd best not leave him like that for too long, or you'll never hear the end of it.*

Deathvoice_Reminder_6.speaker: Narrator
Deathvoice_Reminder_6.text: *If Gale were alive right now, he'd impress upon you the urgency of his resurrection. You might want to look into that.*

Deathvoice_Reminder_7.speaker: Narrator
Deathvoice_Reminder_7.text: *Gale's lifeless body hardly seems like the source of a cataclysmic, world-ending event, but it is beginning to smell a little.*

Deathvoice_Reminder_4.speaker: Narrator
Deathvoice_Reminder_4.text: *The best resurrections are timely ones. Best not leave him there too long.*

Deathvoice_Reminder_8.speaker: Narrator
Deathvoice_Reminder_8.text: *Whatever death means for others, you know it means something far, far worse for Gale. And yourself, if he is not brought back to life.*

PAD_SawIronFlask_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawIronFlask_Single_0.text: The magic nearly oozes from this flask. Gale might be interested.

DeathFlute_45.speaker: Narrator
DeathFlute_45.text: *Now that K'ha'ssji'trach'ash has done his duty, the flute's duty too has been fulfilled.*

DeathFlute_57.speaker: Narrator
DeathFlute_57.text: *This is the flute Gale kept on his person. A faint magical aura envelops its wooden surface.*
DeathFlute_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player holds a small, magical flute.

DeathFlute_63.speaker: Player
DeathFlute_63.text: Try to play a little ditty.

DeathFlute_92.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player plays a little tune on the flute. It sounds great!

DeathFlute_30.speaker: Shadowheart
DeathFlute_30.text: Pretty tune. You're better with your mouth than I would have figured.

DeathFlute_4.speaker: Karlach
DeathFlute_4.text: Handsome and talented. Goodness me, I'm a goner.

DeathFlute_14.speaker: Astarion
DeathFlute_14.text: Bravo! I didn't think you had it in you.

DeathFlute_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player plays a little tune on the flute. It sounds awful.

DeathFlute_83.speaker: Lae'zel
DeathFlute_83.text: Enough. I've heard sweeter sounds from a dying vrock.

DeathFlute_23.speaker: Shadowheart
DeathFlute_23.text: Oofh... wonderful rendition of a dying crow.
DeathFlute_23.context: NodeContext: Spoken with a wince - the player's efforts on a flute are less than harmonious.

DeathFlute_9.speaker: Karlach
DeathFlute_9.context: NodeContext: Spoken with a wince - the player's efforts on a flute are less than harmonious.

DeathFlute_85.speaker: Astarion
DeathFlute_85.text: Just be grateful that my ears can't bleed.

DeathFlute_15.speaker: Wyll
DeathFlute_15.text: Ah, yes, that classic tune: 'Ode to a Shrieking Owlbear'.

DeathFlute_65.speaker: Player
DeathFlute_65.text: Play the tune again that will summon the mephit.

DeathFlute_22.speaker: Player
DeathFlute_22.text: Position your fingers on the flute, ready to play individual notes.

DeathFlute_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays an A on the flute.

DeathFlute_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays an B on the flute.

DeathFlute_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays a C on the flute.

DeathFlute_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays a D on the flute.

DeathFlute_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays an E on the flute.

DeathFlute_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays an A on the flute.

DeathFlute_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays a D on the flute. A magma mephit appears, summoned by the flute.

DeathFlute_44.speaker: Magma Mephit
DeathFlute_44.context: NodeContext: Kwess-taka? (What do you require of me?)

DeathFlute_33.speaker: Magma Mephit
DeathFlute_33.context: NodeContext: Daa-jaa-jaa-sum! (Yes, that's who I am!)

DeathFlute_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds up letter, mephit breathes one it.

DeathFlute_21.speaker: Magma Mephit
DeathFlute_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magma mephit disappears.NodeContext: Thi-nuthranta-manthra Gale. (Take good care of Gale.)

DeathFlute_94.speaker: Magma Mephit
DeathFlute_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magma mephit disappears.NodeContext: Wik-nah-vulling. (Leave if you must.)

DeathFlute_5.speaker: Player
DeathFlute_5.text: I haven't a clue what you're saying.

DeathFlute_36.speaker: Magma Mephit
DeathFlute_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magma mephit disappears.NodeContext: Nu-zvjet! (You're wrong!)

DeathFlute_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays an E on the flute.

DeathFlute_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays an F on the flute.

DeathFlute_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character plays a G on the flute.

DeathFlute_41.speaker: Narrator
DeathFlute_41.text: *That wasn't the right note. You'll have to start anew.*

DeathFlute_90.speaker: Narrator
DeathFlute_90.text: *Gale's magic flute is ready to be played.*
DeathFlute_90.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player holds a small, magical flute.

PAD_SawMyconidItem_Double_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawMyconidItem_Double_0.text: That drow cowl might have bits of magic lingering inside it. Any thoughts, Gale?

PAD_SawMyconidItem_Double_1.speaker: Gale
PAD_SawMyconidItem_Double_1.text: Drow magic radiates from it. And drow are masters at magic.

AD_AvatarStrengthens_0.speaker: Gale
AD_AvatarStrengthens_0.text: Ah... much better. The Weave makes me feel like a new man.

AD_AvatarStrengthens_1.speaker: Gale
AD_AvatarStrengthens_1.text: Hells, I felt almost nothing - the flow of the Weave was barely a trickle. There must be another solution.
AD_AvatarStrengthens_1.context: NodeContext: Desperate. His go-to 'medicine' is no longer effective.

AD_AvatarStrengthens_2.speaker: Gale
AD_AvatarStrengthens_2.text: A little relief... but not much. The Weave seems fainter somehow. Is something amiss?
AD_AvatarStrengthens_2.context: NodeContext: Concerned. His go-to 'medicine' is less effective than usual.

PAD_SawDangerousBook_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawDangerousBook_Single_0.text: Hm. From the looks of that book, Gale might want it.

PAD_SawHagItem_Double_1.speaker: Player
PAD_SawHagItem_Double_1.text: Strange-looking staff. Is that something you'd want, Gale?

PAD_SawHagItem_Double_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_SawHagItem_Double_0.text: I think you're on to something.

PAD_GotIdol_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotIdol_Single_0.text: I bet this idol's powerful enough for Gale to get something out of it.

AD_AvatarWorsens_0.speaker: Gale
AD_AvatarWorsens_0.text: Hells, I need a magic item - now. Anything that the Weave flows through.
AD_AvatarWorsens_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale gets worse for the first time. He has consumed no magic items, and is presumably only learning about his affliction.NodeContext: Urgent/in great discomfort. He's weakening because he's gone too long without taking his 'medicine' (consuming a magical item to keep himself alive)

AD_AvatarWorsens_1.speaker: Gale
AD_AvatarWorsens_1.text: Ugh... I'm fading. I need a pick-me-up. Something with the essence of the Weave.
AD_AvatarWorsens_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale gets worse for the first time. He has consumed no magic items, and is presumably only learning about his affliction.NodeContext: Discomfort. He's weakening because he's gone too long without taking his 'medicine' (consuming a magical item to keep himself alive)

AD_AvatarWorsens_2.speaker: Gale
AD_AvatarWorsens_2.text: Ah... can't go on much longer. I need to feel the Weave... a magic item - something.
AD_AvatarWorsens_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale gets worse for the first time. He has consumed no magic items, and is presumably only learning about his affliction.NodeContext: Increasing discomfort. He's weakening because he's gone too long without taking his 'medicine' (consuming a magical item to keep himself alive)

PAD_SawMyconidItem_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawMyconidItem_Single_0.text: That drow cowl might have bits of magic lingering inside it. Something for Gale.

PAD_SawIronFlask_Double_1.speaker: Player
PAD_SawIronFlask_Double_1.text: The magic nearly oozes from this flask. Can you use it?

PAD_SawIronFlask_Double_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_SawIronFlask_Double_0.text: A fortunate find indeed. Allow me to take it off your hands.

PAD_SawIdol_Double_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawIdol_Double_0.text: A god's idol has to have some magic lingering in it. Your sort of thing, Gale?

PAD_SawIdol_Double_1.speaker: Gale
PAD_SawIdol_Double_1.text: Silvanus is an ancient and powerful god. I'm sure the magic in that idol is... delicious.

PAD_GotDuergarItem_Double_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotDuergarItem_Double_0.text: These boots have clearly been enchanted with powerful magic.

PAD_GotDuergarItem_Double_1.speaker: Gale
PAD_GotDuergarItem_Double_1.text: Indeed. Exactly the sort of thing I'm looking for.

PAD_GotIronFlask_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotIronFlask_Single_0.text: The magic nearly oozes from this flask. Gale might be interested.

PAD_GotTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double_0.text: This sword has all kinds of power running through it. Gale, want a look?

PAD_GotTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double_1.speaker: Gale
PAD_GotTollhouseMagicalWeapon_Double_1.text: A fine blade. Almost a pity to absorb it's magic, but I do so have need of it.

PAD_DeathNoteLava_1.speaker: Player
PAD_DeathNoteLava_1.text: Ah, it worked. Who needs mephits when you have a convenient lava pool?
PAD_DeathNoteLava_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Players have heard of the protocol but instead just thrown the scroll into lava.NodeContext: figured out a way to bypass a magical procedure to obtain a scroll.

PAD_DeathNoteLava_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_DeathNoteLava_0.text: Interesting workaround... though not one that can be counted on it all circumstances.

PAD_DeathNoteLava_2.speaker: Player
PAD_DeathNoteLava_2.text: A scroll of true resurrection? Wasn't expecting that...
PAD_DeathNoteLava_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Players haven't heard of the protocol, threw a scroll into lava, and it became a scroll of resurrection.NodeContext: Some surprise (threw a scroll into lava, causing it to change)

PAD_DeathNoteLava_3.speaker: Player
PAD_DeathNoteLava_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Only Gale available for voicebark.

PAD_SawDuergarItem_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawDuergarItem_Single_0.text: Those boots look quite special. Something for Gale, maybe?

PAD_GotHagItem_Double_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotHagItem_Double_0.text: A hag's staff has to be brimming with magic. Take a look, Gale.

PAD_GotHagItem_Double_1.speaker: Gale
PAD_GotHagItem_Double_1.text: A hag's magic is nothing to be scoffed at. Yes, this will suit perfectly.

AD_BombComplain_0.speaker: Gale
AD_BombComplain_0.context: NodeContext: Slightly pained/struggling with a constant ache (the orb is negatively afffecting him, causing him pain. Prompt is to remind the player that Gale is unwell.)

PAD_GotMyconidItem_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotMyconidItem_Single_0.text: This cowl's definitely enchanted. Gale could use this.

PAD_SawSeluneItem_Double_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawSeluneItem_Double_0.text: Seems like that Selûnite amulet might catch your eye, Gale.

PAD_SawSeluneItem_Double_1.speaker: Gale
PAD_SawSeluneItem_Double_1.text: Moonmaiden's magic. Both beautiful and powerful indeed.

PAD_SawSeluneItem_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawSeluneItem_Single_0.text: If that Selûnite amulet is really god-touched, Gale would want to see it.

PAD_GotIdol_Double_1.speaker: Player
PAD_GotIdol_Double_1.text: Bet this idol has a bit of divine spark left. Something Gale can use.

PAD_GotIdol_Double_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_GotIdol_Double_0.text: It brims with Weave. It is... quite remarkable.

PAD_GotDangerousBook_Double_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotDangerousBook_Double_0.text: Bet this book of necromancy has some hefty magic in it. Gale, what do you think?

PAD_GotDangerousBook_Double_1.speaker: Gale
PAD_GotDangerousBook_Double_1.text: Ah, a Thayan artefact. Yes, this is very promising.

PAD_GotHagItem_Single_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GotHagItem_Single_0.text: I bet Gale will want to take a look at this staff.

DeathPouch_4.speaker: Narrator
DeathPouch_4.text: *The pouch is sealed with differently coloured strands of thread.*
DeathPouch_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player holds a sealed pouch.

DeathPouch_9.speaker: Narrator
DeathPouch_9.text: *An inscription on the leather reads: 'Do not open unless I have instructed you to do so. In case of doubt, await instructions near my body. Gale, Wizard of Waterdeep.'*
DeathPouch_9.context: NodeContext: the last part, Gale's name and 'title', are his sign-off at the end of the note

DeathPouch_11.speaker: Player
DeathPouch_11.text: Pull the purple thread in a counter clockwise fashion.

DeathPouch_7.speaker: Narrator
DeathPouch_7.text: *As the purple thread becomes undone, the pouch opens to reveal a letter and flute inside.*

DeathPouch_8.speaker: Player
DeathPouch_8.text: Pull the threads to open the pouch.

DeathPouch_10.speaker: Narrator
DeathPouch_10.text: *You get a feeling something's wrong. It's as if the pouch struggles against you.*
DeathPouch_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player tries to open the pouch, but it's not working.

DeathPouch_6.speaker: Narrator
DeathPouch_6.text: *As the threads become undone, the pouch itself evaporates.*
DeathPouch_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player violently opens the pouch, which makes it evaporate, i.e. self-destruct.

DeathPouch_3.speaker: Narrator
DeathPouch_3.text: *The letter and flute inside are now forever beyond your grasp.*
DeathPouch_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player is left standing with empty hands.

DeathPouch_0.speaker: Narrator
DeathPouch_0.text: *Whatever contents were inside, they've been utterly destroyed.*
DeathPouch_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player is left standing with empty hands.
